skill.name: doc-coauthoring
skill.description: Guide users through a structured workflow for co-authoring documentation. Use when user wants to write documentation, proposals, technical specs, decision docs, or similar structured content. This workflow helps users efficiently transfer context, refine content through iteration, and verify the doc works for readers. Trigger when user mentions writing docs, creating proposals, drafting specs, or similar documentation tasks.

security_audit.summary: Official skill with a documented workflow for document co-authoring. No executable code or external access patterns were found in the scanned file.

content.user_title: Start a structured document co-authoring flow
content.value_statement: Long documents fail when context is missing or structure is weak. This skill guides you through stages to gather context, draft sections, and test reader clarity.
actual_capabilities: Ask structured context questions before drafting
Guide section by section drafting with brainstorming and curation
Create a document scaffold with placeholders
Run reader testing with predicted questions
limitations: Does not access external documents without integrations
Requires user input for content and decisions
Cannot run sub-agents if unavailable in the environment

use_cases.title: Draft a PRD
use_cases.description: Build a PRD with clear goals, scope, and decisions through guided sections.

use_cases.title: Write a technical spec
use_cases.description: Capture architecture, tradeoffs, and implementation steps with structured prompts.

use_cases.title: Create a decision doc
use_cases.description: Document options, rationale, and risks with iterative refinement and testing.

prompt_templates.title: Start a doc
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a topic but no structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me start a technical spec. Ask your context questions and set up the sections.

prompt_templates.title: Refine a section
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a draft section to improve
prompt_templates.prompt: Refine my proposal section. Ask clarifying questions, brainstorm options, then draft it.

prompt_templates.title: Fill gaps
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my decision doc outline and ask questions to surface missing context.

prompt_templates.title: Reader test
prompt_templates.prompt: Run reader testing on my document and report what a fresh reader would miss.

output_examples.input: Help me draft a decision doc for migrating our API gateway
output: Questions about audience, impact, and constraints
Drafted core decision section after curation

best_practices: Provide an initial context dump before drafting
Confirm section order and start with the most uncertain parts
Use reader testing to catch hidden assumptions
anti_patterns: Skipping context gathering and jumping to a full draft
Editing the document without sharing changes back
Ignoring reader testing when multiple stakeholders will read it

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is a workflow skill that works across these platforms.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It relies on your input and does not verify facts or access data without tools.

faq.question: Can it integrate with docs or chat tools?
faq.answer: It can use integrations if available, otherwise you must paste content.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: Content stays in the session unless you use external connectors.

faq.question: What if the draft feels generic?
faq.answer: Provide more context and request another refinement cycle.

faq.question: How does it compare to freeform drafting?
faq.answer: It adds structure, questions, and testing to reduce gaps and rework.
